A 50 year old man undergoes surgery for a large left sided carotid body tumor. Post operative his left pupils are smaller than right and his left eye lid drops. This is due to :

Correct Answer: Damage to cervical sympathetic chain on the left side

Option 1: Preferred at the level of iliac crest as the cord ends above this level
Option 2: At the level of trans tubercular plane as the sacral canal is widest here
Option 3: At the level of posterior inferior iliac spine

Correct Answer: Preferred at the level of iliac crest as the cord ends above this level

Question: Which of the following can be used as surface anatomy of internal carotid artery?

Question: With regards to the jugular vein, which of the following statements is untrue?

Option 3: The terminal part of the thoracic duct crosses anterior to it to insert into the right subclavian vein
Option 4: The hypoglossal nerve is closely related to it as it passes near the atlas

Correct Answer: The terminal part of the thoracic duct crosses anterior to it to insert into the right subclavian vein
